NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis U|, Minnesota
March 6, 1957
Mr, Prank Schooley
Station WILL-AM-FM-TV
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Prank:
When I returned to the office Monday I had a total of 12
letters from you, delivered by Harry Skornia at Ann Arbor or by
the mailman here in Minneapolis, I certainly appreciate the
time and attention you are continuing to give to NAEB affairs.
My only concern is that, as past-president, you will set an
example which will result in the next past-president (me, that isi)
also having to work long hours for the Association at a time when
he might feel that a rest was deserved!
Thank you for the information about the JCET meeting. I am
sorry I couldn't attend, but a temperature of 102 for three days
left me with little choice. I talked to Ralph in Boston though,
and he told me that there would be a meeting of the Executive
Committee on the evening of March 17 and of the full council on
the 18th. I shall try to be present at these. I discussed some
NAEB-JCET-ETRC problems with Harry Newburn in Ann Arbor, and
further with Ralph and Dick Hull in Boston. I hope you and I
can have a chat in Washington on this topic.
Another important subject is that of NAEB foundation relations,
I think we should have a meeting of the Foundations Committee in
order to firm up our policy and approaches both to Kellogg and
Ford. How would a day or two in the last week of March in Urbana
suit you? Dick would be free a couple of days during that week.
(I shall get in touch with Jim Miles after I get your schedule.)
Would this be soon enough to draw up policies in regard to both
groups as well as to explore other foundation possibilities?
In this connection, I should like to have Marguerite Fleming
meet with us to talk about the convention. She seems worried about
this, and earnestly requests a meeting. By having her come to
Urbana rather than having Harry and/or me go to St. Louis, we
should be able to conduct other NAEB business in addition to that
